info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 08 at 10:26PM EDT until July 09 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT SATURDAY FOR CENTRAL ALBEMARLE COUNTY AND THE CITY OF CHARLOTTESVILLE... At 1026 PM EDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing flash flooding across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Charlottesville... Scott Stadium... Newcomb Hall... Barracks... Overton... Monticello... Batesville... FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
